quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Story and Character
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, cunninghams, smith. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This series depicts a unicorn-riding wizard, who is actually a contestant in a game show, in the futuristic world of Proton.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Apprentice Adept

questions.question: Johnny Smith is a character that awakens from a coma in which Stephen King story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dead Zone

questions.question: The fictional spice-drug Melange has a central role in which Sci-fi epic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: DUNE

questions.question: This popular fantasy series tells the story of a small human-like character, sent on a mission to save the world. He has to destroy an item of dark and terrible power by casting it into the fires of the mountain, where it was made.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord of the Rings

questions.question: Which author describes the worlds of the Belgariad and the Malloreon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Eddings

questions.question: Arnie Cunninghams character is a nerdy high school student from which Stephen King story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christine

questions.question: Billy Halleck, a rather rotund lawyer, is a character from which Stephen King story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thinner

questions.question: What fantasy series tells us first about a sword, then about the elfstones and finally about a wishsong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shannara

questions.question: Pennywise is introduced to us in a storm sewer from which Stephen King story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It

questions.question: The paraplegic Marty Coslaw is a character in which Stephen King story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silver Bullet

questions.question: This fantasy series features channelers, who can control the One Power, a mighty force that comes from the True Source, and is separated into two halves: a male part -saidin, and a female one - saidar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wheel of Time

questions.question: In which Stephen King story are we introduced to a recovering alcoholic named Jack Torrance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Shining

questions.question: In which Stephen King story to we meet the intriguing stranger Andre Linoge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Storm of the Century

questions.question: In this sci-fi story, a young boy is given advanced training and then tricked into destroying an invading an alien fleet.

options.text: The Boat of a Million Years

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Enders Game

questions.question: The former nurse Annie Wilkes is a character from which Stephen King story?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Misery

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and Wind
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, philip, quote. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This quote is from a novel which focuses on the myth of hedonism: ‘The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it. Resist it, and your soul grows sick with longing for the things it has forbidden to itself, with desire for what its monstrous laws have made monstrous and unlawful.’  Name the novel.

options.text: A Portrait of the Artist As a Young Man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Picture of Dorian Gray

questions.question: In the novel Gone with the Wind, what was the name of Scarletts first house -- the house she had her childhood in and loved more than anything?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tara

questions.question: Name the 19th century novel, which begins with the following sentence: ‘It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.’
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pride and Prejudice

questions.question: Which Fantasy Series tells the story of  the War Wizard, Richard Rahl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sword of Truth

questions.question: In this novel, with the following sentences, David Lodge sums up the fact that his Catholic characters ceased to believe in the existence of hell: ‘At some point in the nineteen-sixties, Hell disappeared. No one could say for certain when this happened. First it was there and then it wasn’t.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: How Far Can You Go

questions.question: The following quote is from a novel which describes a society, characterized mainly by the lack of freedom: ‘Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four. If that is granted, all else follows.’  Name the novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1984

questions.question: How many children did Scarlett have in the novel Gone with the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: Which war is described in the novel Gone with the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Civil War

questions.question: In the novel Gone with the Wind, what is Scarlett O Haras first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katie

questions.question: Which sci-fi classic features the story of an alien invasion thwarted by earths microorganisms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War of the Worlds

questions.question: In the novel Gone with the Wind, Scarletts father bought two slaves from Raif Tarleton.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The main character from this literary work by Philip Roth addresses the following words to his domineering and meticulous Jewish mother: ‘Because to be bad, Mother, that is the real struggle: to be bad and to enjoy it. That is what makes men of us boys.’
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Portnoys Complaint

questions.question: Which fantasy series by C.S. Lewis includes a book entitled The Voyage of the Dawn Treader?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Chronicles of Narnia

questions.question: In the novel Gone with the Wind, Dilcey had two children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the novel Gone with the Wind, what were the names of the two slaves Scarletts father bought, and what relationship did they have?

options.text: DIlcey and Prissy, mother and daughter

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: DIlcey and Prissy, mother and daughter

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Book and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, title, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 1971 Dr. Seuss book about a mossy,  bossy creature, the Once-ler and the Truffula trees has been banned by some schools and libraries for its anti-forestry industry content.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Lorax

questions.question: The following quote is from a literary work by Kurt Vonnegut in which the characters search for an important and dangerous substance called ‘ice-nine’: ‘Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before. He is full of murderous resentment of people who are ignorant without having come by their ignorance the hard way.’  Name the literary work.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cats Cradle

questions.question: Published in January 1990, this is the last book written and illustrated by Dr. Seuss. In the US, its a popular graduation gift.

options.text: I Am NOT Going to Get Up Today!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oh, the Places Youll Go!

questions.question: After Dr. Seuss used 236 different words to write The Cat in the Hat, his publisher, Bennett Cerf, bet $50 that Seuss could not write a book of only fifty words. Seuss won the bet with this book in 1960.

options.text: Theres a Wocket in My Pocket!
One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Blue Fish

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Green Eggs and Ham

questions.question: In this novel, the following words are said by the protagonist, Isadora Wing, who is in pursuit of liberation: ‘I was nobody’s baby now. Liberated. Utterly free. It was the most terrifying sensation I’d ever known in my life. Like teetering on the edge of the Grand Canyon and hoping you’d learn to fly before you hit the bottom.

options.text: A Good Man Is Hard to Find

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fear of Flying

questions.question: The title of this 1956 Dr. Seuss book has become a popular phrase used to introduce an opinion.

options.text: And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: If I Ran the Circus

questions.question: Voyage of the Dawn Treader was written by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: C S Lewis

questions.question: The plot of this 1984 Seuss satire has been likened to the war between Blefuscu and Lilliput in Jonathan Swifts Gullivers Travel and their war over which end of an egg is supposed to be cracked.

options.text: Theres a Wocket in My Pocket!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Butter Battle Book

questions.question: Youre a Mean One, Mr. Grinch, one of the most famous songs from the 1966 animated TV special How the Grinch Stole Christmas!, was sung by the narrator Boris Karloff.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The following speculation is from a novel set in the gloomy Fen Country of East Anglia: ‘Realitys not strange, not unexpected. Reality doesnt reside in the sudden hallucination of events. Reality is uneventfulness, vacancy, flatness. Reality is that nothing happens. How many of the events of history have occurred, ask yourselves, for this and for that reason, but for no other reason, fundamentally, than the desire to make things happen?’  Can you name the novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waterland

questions.question: This quote is from a novel by Somerset Maugham, which tells the story of a young man searching for the meaning of life:  ‘It is an illusion that youth is happy, an illusion of those who have lost it; but the young know they are wretched, for they are full of the truthless ideals which have been instilled into them and each time they come in contact with the real they are bruised and wounded.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Of Human Bondage

questions.question: In this 1954 Dr. Seuss book the moral of the story (and a repeated phrase throughout the book) is: a persons a person no matter how small. This was the first of two Seuss books starring this kind-hearted elephant.

options.text: Theres a Wocket in My Pocket!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Horton Hears a Who!

questions.question: This is a quote from a novel in which the action takes place in a mental institution: ‘You have to laugh at the things that hurt you just to keep yourself in balance, just to keep the world from running you plumb crazy.’  Name the novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ‘One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest’

questions.question: What book by Dr. Seuss contains the quote: When a Fox is in the bottle where the Tweetle Beetles battle with their paddles in a puddle on a noodle-eating poodle, THIS is what they call......a Tweetle Beetle Noodle Poodle Bottled Paddled Muddled Duddled Fuddled Wuddled Fox In Socks, Sir!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fox in Socks

questions.question: Published in 1937, this is Dr. Seusss first book. Its main character Marco is based on Marco McClintock, the son of Mike McClintock, Seuss editor, and Helene McClintock, to whom he dedicated the book.

options.text: Theres a Wocket in My Pocket!
And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: And to Think That I Saw It on Mulberry Street

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and Work
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, fyodor, death. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This novel by Charles Dickens, published in 1850, is considered his most autobiographical. It begins with: Whether I shall turn out to be the hero of my own life, or whether that station will be held by anybody else, these pages must show. Characters include Wilkins Micawber and Uriah Heep.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Copperfield

questions.question: Dante Alighieri (1265-1321) probably began this work in 1306. Its first canto begins with: Midway upon the journey of our life I found myself within a forest dark, for the straightforward pathway had been lost.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Divine Comedy

questions.question: This famous childrens poet wrote Where the Sidewalk Ends and The Giving Tree.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shel Silverstien

questions.question: Death be not proud, though some have called thee mighty and dreadfull, for, thou art not so is a portion of a work by this poet who lived from 1572-1631.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Donne

questions.question: This early Anglo-Saxon work, possibly from the 800s, features the antagonist Grendel, a descendant of Cain who invades the mead-hall of the Danes and eats the men within. The title character ultimately beheads Grendel and keeps it as a trophy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beowulf

questions.question: The famous line In the room the women come and go, talking of Michelangelo is from the poem The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock by this influential 20th century poet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: T. S. Eliot

questions.question: This novel by Charlotte Brontë includes the character Mr. Rochester, whose wife is a violent lunatic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Eyre

questions.question: This 1971 novel by Anthony Burgess relates the story of a fifteen-year-old boy named Alex, who, with his gang members (known as droogs) roam the streets at night, committing violent crimes for enjoyment.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Clockwork Orange

questions.question: In what 1851 novel would you find the characters Ishmael, Captain Ahab, Queequeg and Starbuck?

options.text: Voyage of the Dawn Treader by C. S. Lewis
Heart of Darkness by Joseph Conrad

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moby Dick by Herman Melville

questions.question: As Gregor Samsa awoke one morning from uneasy dreams he found himself transformed in his bed into a gigantic insect is the opening line to this famous work of German fiction by Franz Kafka.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Metamorphosis

questions.question: The Canterbury Tales is a collection of stories written by Geoffrey Chaucer. It recounts the tales told by individuals on a pilgrimage to the shrine of Saint Thomas Becket at Canterbury Cathedral. Which of the following was not a character in this work?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tax Collector

questions.question: This great work of Russian literature by Fyodor Dostoevsky features the character Raskolnikov, an impoverished St. Petersburg student who kills an unscrupulous pawnbroker.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crime and Punishment

questions.question: In the novel Don Quixote by Spanish author Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra, who is the witty squire and companion to Alonso Quixano?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sancho Panza

questions.question: Fifteen men on the dead mans chest— Yo-ho-ho, and a bottle of rum! is a famous line from Treasure Island, a novel by this author published in 1883.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Louis Stevenson

questions.question: In this tragic play by William Shakespeare, three witches tell a general in the army of King Duncan that he will never be vanquishd until Great Birnam wood to high Dunsinane Hill shall come against him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Macbeth

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and Kings
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, percy, report. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Once in a kingdom called Delain, there was a king with two sons. Delain was a very old kingdom and it had had hundreds of kings, perhaps, even thousands... is the beginning of what book?

options.text: The Dark Tower I: The Gunslinger
The  Dark Tower IV: The Wizard and the Glass

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Eyes of the Dragon

questions.question: In chapter one of Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, Harry has Snapes essay on Sleeping Draughts hidden under the floorboard.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: On what day did Percy say he would have the report ready for Mr Crouch?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tuesday

questions.question: Who fell into the lake?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dennis

questions.question: What is Stephen Kings first published novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carrie

questions.question: What is the name of Dolores Claibornes wealthy employer in the Stephen King novel Dolores Claiborne?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vera Donovan

questions.question: What novel did Stephen King and Peter Straub co-author in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Talisman

questions.question: In the horror novel Misery, Annie Wilkes was referred to by the newspapers as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Dragon Lady

questions.question: In the novel Pet Semetary, what is the name of the Creeds cat that is buried and returns to life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Church

questions.question: Where do Harry Potter and Ron leave the chocolate cakes for Crabbe and Goyle to find?

options.text: At the end of the banister
Floating near the entrance to the Slytherin Common Room
Floating mid-air in the exit of the Great Hall

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At the end of the banister

questions.question: George used the Jelly-Legs curse on Goyle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Goblet of Fire started a series of deaths in the books. Who died in Goblet of Fire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cedric Diggory

questions.question: Harry rescued Hermione from the Merpeople.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the novel Cristine, Dennis decides he does not like Christine, because, while sitting in it, he has a vision of the car and the surroundings as they would be in 1957 when the car was new.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In Stephen Kings novel Bag of Bones, what is the location of the Noonans summer home?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Laughs

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Wind and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, dudleys, opening. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In chapter 7 of Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban, titled The Boggart in the Wardrobe, a severed hand comes out of the wardrobe for Seamus Finnegan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: The company that produced Gone with the Wind was fined because Rhett  Butler says the word damn in his famous line: Frankly my dear, I dont give a damn.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How much did David O. Selznick pay for the rights to the book Gone with the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $50,000

questions.question: Who portrayed Ashley Wilkes in the popular movie Gone with the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leslie Howard

questions.question: The producer of the movie Gone with the Wind was short of money and needed a male lead. With whom did he make a deal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: With his father-in-law

questions.question: Who wrote the novel Gone With the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Margaret Mitchell

questions.question: In chapter 24 of book 5, what breaks Snapes attempt to use Legilimency on Harry Potter?

options.text: Fluffys attack on Harry, Hermione and Ron
The vision of Cedrics dead body

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The vision of Cedrics dead body

questions.question: In 2000, Alice Randall wrote a new version of Gone With the Wind in which the story is told from the point of view of the slaves. What was the name of this novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wind Done Gone

questions.question: Three men are given credit as directors of the movie Gone with the Wind. Which one of the following directors is not among them?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raoul Walsh

questions.question: In 1962, the best known music theme from the movie Gone with the Wind often called Taras Theme, was made into a hit record on the pop charts. Which group had a 1962 hit with My Own True Love?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Duprees

questions.question: What room does Harry Potter go to for his hearing in the 5th book of the series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Courtroom 10

questions.question: Rons Christmas gift to Dobby in Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire is a tea cozy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How long does Dudleys tongue become, after eating Fred and Georges candies, in the fourth book of the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 ft.

questions.question: The weapon that Voldemort wanted in book 5 of the Harry Potter series was Harry.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Excluding the opening music, the intermission, and exit music, how long does the movie Gone with the Wind run?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 222 minutes
